Half-angle formulae

If we replace \(x\) by \(\dfrac{x}{2}\) and, consequently \(2x\) by \(x\) in the double angle formula, we obtain \[ \sin x\equiv 2\sin\left(\dfrac{x}{2}\right)\cos\left(\dfrac{x}{2}\right) \]


Similarly for the cosine: \[ \cos x\equiv 2\cos^2\left(\dfrac{x}{2}\right)-1 \]

These are examples of half-angle formulae.

\(\cos A= \dfrac{1-t^2}{1+t^2}\)
